required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on Medical Records of Women Using an Intrauterine Device (IUD) for Birth Control to Analyze the Risks That the IUD Will be Expelled or Perforates the Womb in Relation to Breastfeeding, the Point in Time When the IUD Was Inserted After Childbirth and in Relation to Different Types of IUDs
clinical_study.official_title: Study on the Association of Uterine Perforation and Intrauterine Device (IUD) Expulsion With Breastfeeding Status at the Time of IUD Insertion and Postpartum Timing of IUD Insertion in Electronic Medical Record Databases - A Postmarketing Requirement for Mirena

brief_summary.textblock:
Study to analyze electronic medical records of women using an intrauterine device (IUD) for birth control. The study is required by the FDA for the marketed IUD Mirena (US Post-marketing requirement; short name of study: APEX IUD).
The study will analyze the risks that the IUD is expelled or perforates the womb for the following group comparisons:
- Women who are breastfeeding at the time of IUD insertion versus women who are not breastfeeding at the time of IUD insertion.
- Women who had a first observed IUD insertion within different time periods after childbirth (i.e., ≤ 6 weeks, > 6 weeks and ≤ 14 weeks, > 14 weeks and ≤ 52 weeks) versus women who had their first observed IUD insertion more than 52 weeks after childbirth, including women without a recorded delivery within the past 52 weeks.
The study will also analyze the risks that the IUD is expelled or perforates the womb for different types of IUDs. In addition, the study aims to assess the following interactions:
- The extent to which the type of IUD (IUDs releasing the hormone LNG versus Copper IUDs) modifies the risk that an IUD is expelled or perforates the womb in relation to breastfeeding and/ or in relation to the point in time when the IUD was inserted after childbirth.
- The extent to which the breastfeeding status modifies the risk that an IUD is expelled or perforates the womb in relation to the point in time when the IUD was inserted after childbirth.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
primary_outcome.description: Person-time at risk is the time without uterine perforation, intrauterine device (IUD) expulsion or censoring event (in years, months, or days) that all subjects contributed to the study since enrollment. Censoring events comprise e.g. IUD-removal, IUD-reinsertion, pregnancy, hysterectomy, sterilization, expiration of IUD, death, disenrollment from database.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
primary_outcome.description: Yes / No variable: 0 = No date of uterine perforation confirmed during the person-time at risk; 1 = Yes, date of uterine perforation confirmed during the person-time at risk.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
primary_outcome.description: Yes / No variable: 0 = No date of intrauterine device (IUD) expulsion confirmed during the person-time at risk; 1 = Yes, date of IUD-expulsion confirmed during the person-time at risk.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Number of cases of uterine perforation per 1000 person-years.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Number of uterine perforations per number of IUD-insertions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Number of cases of IUD-expulsion per 1000 person-years.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Number of IUD-expulsions per number of IUD-insertions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Number of difficult IUD-insertions per number of IUD-insertions. Difficult IUD-insertions are assessed by e.g. need for cervical dilation, ultrasound guidance, clinical experience.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted hazard ratio of uterine perforation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Measure describing the risk of having uterine perforation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Measure describing the risk of having an IUD-expulsion

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted incidence rate ratio (IRR) of uterine perforation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted incidence rate difference (IRD) of uterine perforation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted incidence rate ratio (IRR) of IUD-expulsion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted incidence rate difference (IRD) of IUD-expulsion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Interactions to evaluate the extent to which breast-feeding status modified the association of uterine perforations at different periods of time. Association ranges between 0 (= no association) and 1 (=strong association).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective analysis of data from 2001 to 2018
secondary_outcome.description: Interactions to evaluate the extent to which breast-feeding status modified the association of IUD-expulsion at different periods of time. Association ranges between 0 (= no association) and 1 (=strong association).

arm_group.description: Women with an intrauterine device (IUD) and electronic health records in the Kaiser Permanente Northern California (KPNC), Kaiser Permanente Southern California (KPSC), Kaiser Permanente Washington (KPWA) and the Regenstrief Institute (RI) databases.

intervention.description: Intrauterine devices, e.g. BAY86-5028 (Mirena, Skyla, Kyleena), Liletta and ParaGard

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women with evidence in the database of insertion of an IUD (e.g. levonorgestrel-releasing, copper) during the study time window for each site
- Enrolled in the database with electronic medical records available for review for at least 12 months before the IUD insertion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women with more than 50 years of age at the time of the IUD-insertion
